definition: visually attractive/eye candy/easy on the eyes/to protect the eyes
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: This oil painting is very pleasing .
sentences.chinese: 这幅油画可真够养眼的。

sentences.english: Analogous color schemes are often found in nature and are harmonious and pleasing to the eye.
sentences.chinese: 类似色系通常能在大自然中找到，十分和谐，养眼。

sentences.english: I have to say, you're a vision in pinstripes.
sentences.chinese: 我必须指出的是你穿细条纹布料很养眼。

sentences.english: The visuals in this game are definitely nice to look at.
sentences.chinese: 游戏的视觉效果看起来相当养眼。

sentences.english: A fine-looking gentle man sat down in the main dining room of an expensive hotel.
sentences.chinese: 一位很养眼的绅士在一家昂贵的旅馆的餐厅坐下。

sentences.english: The figure looks 'comfortable' in this space and the overall composition is pleasing to the eye.
sentences.chinese: 图片看起来就比较舒服，整个界面就很养眼。

sentences.english: This is the so-called pleasing the eyes and refreshing the mind.
sentences.chinese: 这就是所谓的养眼养心。

sentences.english: But I think he is eye-pleasing.
Then mark yourself down and hire the looker.
sentences.chinese: 是，降低标准，聘用那个养眼的人吧。

sentences.english: Beauty can be eye-pleasing or low.
sentences.chinese: 漂亮可以很养眼或者低俗。

definition: warms the heart and delights the eye (idiom)/pleasing/delightful
able to withstand careful appreciation/well worth a second look
good-looking/nice-looking/good (of a movie, book, TV show etc)/embarrassed/humiliated
as fresh and clean as nature (idiom)
attractiveness index (rating of how good-looking sb is)
